trial_identification.studytitle: Impact of pre-operative misoprostol on blood loss during and after elective cesarean delivery.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Impact of pre-operative misoprostol on blood loss during and after elective cesarean delivery.

conditions.healthcondition: blood loss during and after cesarean delivery

interventions.interventions: preoperative adminstration of 400 microgram rectal misoprostol immediately before skin incision.
interventions.comparator: there is control group receiving the standard care which means starting oxytocin infusion in the rate of 340miu/min. after cord clamping.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Amount of blood loss during cesarean delivery assessed by graduated suction machine .
Amount of post-partum blood loss during first 24 hours after delivery by pad weighing.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Difference in hematocrit between pre and post-operative values.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: elective cesarean, full-term pregnancy, normal blood indices, non-compromised average weight fetus.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: labour pains, multiple pregnancy, bleeding disorder or thrombophilia, abnormal placenta(previa or accreta by ultrasound, fetal distress, preterm fetus.

trial_design.concealment: Computer program, sealed envelopes, opened in theater.
trial_design.sequence: counseling of all eligible women, informed consent then randomization using computer program.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 49 Elhoreya street Janaclis, Elraml district, Alexandria, Egypt. post code 03312

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 649 Elhoreya street Janaclis, Elraml district, Alexandria, Egypt. post code 03312

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of this study was to evaluate the efficacy of rectal misoprostol in reducing blood loss during and after cesarean delivery.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: The ethics committee of Alexandria faculty of medicine, Alexandria university.
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Alexandria faculty of medicine, Alexandria university, Alexandria, Egypt. post code 03312
